result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tavion D. Williams

defendant.name: Williams, Tavion D.
defendant.address: 1156 Roland Lane, Apt. 14, Green Bay, WI 54303

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 22CF1058 and 21CF641:  No contact with victim(s): T.M.T. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess or use ANY TYPE of dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
$246.45 warrant fee. Brought to jail on 10/28/22 from Waukesha County.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:06 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF641, 22CF1058.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant fails to appear. 
Atty Robert Gardner appears on behalf of defendant (21CF641 only). 

Date and time set for FPT.
Atty Gardner has no information to provide to Court. 
COURT notes proper service for today's hearing. 

COURT issues $500.00 bench warrant and sets BFH for 11/09/22 at 8:30 a.m. 

Atty Gardner advises he has not been privately retained on 22CF1058; will discuss when can with deft. 

COURT removes JT on 11/10/22.

Adj: 9:08 a.m.
